title: *** Very tough t209 BE Thompson ...now sold!! ***
author: shammus

posts.post_title: *** Very tough t209 BE Thompson ...now sold!! ***
posts.post_content:
Very desireable and popular card in any grade.  Can't remember the last time this card came available anywhere but I believe it's been years since I've seen one made available publically.  I can't recall seeing more than 1-2 for sale in the past decade.  This one has it's flaws however the photo area of this particular card isn't too bad.  Does have chipping and wrinkling on front with some damage to the back. 

In particular, I'm looking for a few cards in trade -

Caramel cards with color variations on front
t210 orange borders (need 5) maybe more?? - Johnston, Thebo, Alexander, Billiard, Munsell
eunc orange borders (need 7) - Davis, Devlin, Doolan, Laporte, Lord, and McConnell AND Wagner batting
d311s (need 8) - Daley, Delhi, Lewis, Maggert, Mohler, Patterson, Peckinpaugh, Rapps
e98 commons (need 4) - orange - Kling, Mullin; red - Kling; green - Vaughn; 
1909 Obaks (need 7) - Brashear, Gandil, Mundorff, Nagle, Reidy, Stovall, Wiggs,  
d310s (Have 7...need the others) - Browning, Delmas, Maggart, Mitze, Ross, Steen, Tiedeman
t204s (need 53): Ball (NY), Bates, Beebe, Blankenship, Bowerman, Bransfield, Burchell, Byrnes, Carrigan, Clymer, Coakley, Coombs, Crandall, Davis, Donahue, Dorner, Fromme, Ganley, Graham, Hoblitzel, Howard, Kahoe, Kleinon, Lobert, Lush, Manning, McAleer, McConnell, McCormick, McIntyre, Merkle, Mitchell, Moran, Morgan, Murname, Murphy, Niles, O’Hare, Pelty, Pfeister, Raymond, Reilly, Ruelbach, Sallee, Schlei, Schulte, Shipke, Smith, Spencer, Stahl, Stephens, Sweeney, Tenney
1918 Zeenuts - need any

Not too eager to sell it, however I'd let it go for $985 if anyone wanted to go that route.

Thanks in advance....

Brian

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=76208&d=1350168904[/IMG]

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=76209&d=1350168917[/IMG]

Bump...BE Thompson is still available. Updated my wantlist up above...

Thanks!
This is an odd question....do you know the origin of the card...the "40" written on the back is in the same writing/position/hand as a t210 I have...Same number for that matter also in pencil.
Thompson has found a new home...thanks to all for the interest!
